Resources

Map & Routes

BikePGH created an interactive map that showcases places that you can safely bike in Pittsburgh. Check it out below.



Download the PDF Version!

In addition to the above map that BikePGH releases, there are many other great resources for those who live in Pittsburgh and/or attend Pitt.
  • University of Pittsburgh's Campus Bike Map: Includes information about bike racks, lockers, and cages on campus, as well as additional bike routes.
  • Three Rivers Heritage Trail Map: A guide to Pittsburgh's riverfront trails assembled by Friends of the Riverfront.
  • Great Allegheny Passage Map: A map of the trail that extends from Pittsburgh to Washington DC, assembled by the Allegheny Trail Alliance.

Bike Shops

Even though this manual is teaching you how to fix your bike, there are going to be times when you'll need help from an expert. Check out the resources below for bike shops in Pittsburgh.

  • The Pitt Bike Cave: A great resource for Pitt students to go and have their bikes fixed for free in a DIY environment. The bike cave also have bikes available for purchase.
  • REI: Another bike shop that's located in Southside is REI Outdoors. REI carries a variety of equipment for outdoor activities, a lot of equipment for cyclists, and also has a bike shop so that you can get your bike repaired by a professional.
  • Trek Bicycle: Trek is a bicycle manufactured and distributor. The store sells a large variety of bikes and has a bike shop for repairs to be made.

Fix it Stations

This manual outlines the repair process for fixing different problems with your bike. However, if you don't have the tools, there are a variety of Fix-it stations around the city of Pittsburgh that have basic tools to fix your bike. Check out the map below to find the locations of these Fix-it Stations.
